name: stubbornness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C2 the quality of being determined to do what you want and refusing to do anything else: His colleagues find his stubbornness difficult to deal with. She is refusing to help out of sheer stubbornness.
the quality of being difficult to move, change, or deal with: I don't think you quite appreciate the stubbornness of the problem. See
stubborn
More examplesFewer examplesHe is likable despite his stubbornness.There is no virtue in blind, stupid stubbornness.A battle of unusual stubbornness ensued.The continued stubbornness of inflation in the services sector is worrying.
